ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: The authors would like to thank the assistance given by the Ministry of Health and Child Care in Zimbabwe at both national and district levels for affording them the opportunity to survey the respondents. They also wish to thank all the people who participated in the questionnaire survey and interviews.

sec.title: Competing interests
sec.p: The authors declare that they have no financial or personal relationships that may have inappropriately influenced them in writing this article.

sec.title: Authors’ contributions
sec.p: A.N. wrote and conceptualised the article by coming up with the particular title. She had to do more research on the pertinent issues of participants’ perceptions of climate change and health hazards, and finalised the article before submitting it to the journal. M.T. did the initial research and also facilitated the collection of primary data. She also provided empirical evidence through informal observations as she had to organise the meetings with the various stakeholders in Mount Darwin. She also applied for the ethics clearance.
